CONVENTIONAL First Cost per Implementati.description: The first cost data of each conventional lighting technology is collected from literature and converted into USD2014/Plm. As there are several conventional lighting technologies, weighing is needed. The Conventional First Cost is calculated using weighted average of first costs for conventional lighting technologies used in residential lighting. The weight is the share of market (market share, no data in Plmh shares available) of the given technology in total global lighting market share (value-based). These market shares are taken from the McKinsey (2012) report. The weights are converted to account for 97% of lighting service. The sum of weights is less (97%) than 1 because not all lighting technologies in use were considered in conventional: LED lighting (accounting for 3 %) is considered as a solution, not as part of the conventional lighting technologies. Installing costs are estimated to be 0USD in residential lighting. Total weight for a particular conventional technology sums to market share for all entries in table.

SOLUTION First Cost per Implementation U.description: The first costs include the purchase prices of lamps. The lamp price data are expressed in various units and currencies, which are converted into USD2014/Plm. If lamp data (luminous flux) is given in the price data, that specific amount of lumens are used for conversion. If not, default values are used.

CONVENTIONAL Lifetime Capacity.description: The weighting factors are based on the market share by McKinsey (2012), but transformed from accounting a total of 69% into accounting to 97% (as LED accounts for 3 % of the Tlmh market, not the sales as the McKinsey does), see Lighting models sheet. Lifetime capacity is calculated as functional units per implementation unit (here Plmh per Plm = hours).

SOLUTION Lifetime Capacity.description: Lifetime capacity is calculated as funtional units per  implementation unit (here Plmh per Plm = hours).

CONVENTIONAL Total Energy Used per Funct.description: Each conventional lamp type may have several table entries, so to maintain the relative market shares of each lamp type, we distribute the marketshare across all entries for the relevant lamp type.

CONVENTIONAL Indirect CO2 Emissions per.description: Data for indirect CO2 emission calculations is collected from literature. Life cycle assessment (LCA) studies are used as references, see sheet Indirect CO2. Only manufacturing (including life cycle phases prior to use, such as manufacturing and raw material acquisition, if analysed separately). The conventional technologies are weighted using their market shares in 2014. Only the most recent (2009-) LCAs are used as references. An average indirect CO2 emission of each technology is calculated in Indirect CO2 sheet. These average values are weighted like the lifetime capacities are: on the basis of market shares by McKinsey (2012) (see Lighting models sheet).

SOLUTION Indirect CO2 Emissions per Unit.description: Data for indirect CO2 emission calculations is collected from literature. Life cycle assessment (LCA) studies are used as references. Only manufacturing (including life cycle phases prior to use, such as manufacturing and raw material acquisition, if analysed separately). Only the most recent (2009-) LCAs are used as references. An average indirect CO2 emission of the solution is calculated in Indirect CO2 sheet. The unit is t CO2eq. per Plmh (functional unit).

SOLUTION Future First Cost per Implement.description: The year of the unit (USD) is not clearly expressed in sources, thus the prices are assumed to be expressed as USD of the particular year or range of years.

Luminous Efficacy - LFL (Linear Fluoresc.description: The conversion for most entries applies a 92% factor to capture 8% losses due to the ballast.
